title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:32 <mflorea> has quit  
01:47 <abusenius> has quit  
01:51 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
02:53 <abusenius> has quit  
06:35 <DrLou> has quit  
06:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:42 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:52 <+mflorea> sdumitriu: ping  
08:53 <@sdumitriu> Pong  
08:53 <@sdumitriu> Hm, it's morning alrady?  
08:53 <+mflorea> yes :)  
08:53 <vmassol> yep  
08:54 <+mflorea> wdyt about displaying both the category management UI and the normal category sheets on the Blog.Categories page. It makes sense because this page is a category but at the same time it has the category management code in its content.  
08:57 <+mflorea> i.e. first display the list of categories + the option to add a new category and then the list of blog posts from the current category, were the "current" category is the root of all categories  
08:59 <+mflorea> i.e. render first the Blog.Categories code (=> category management UI) and then the Blog.CategorySheet (=> because Blog.Categories has an object of type Blog.CategoryClass)  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> Well, I'm not that fond of this solution  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> Blog.Categories is supposed to be an invisible category  
09:10 <@sdumitriu> But my question was:  
09:11 <+mflorea> yes, but right now BlogCategories is both a category and a category directory  
09:11 <@sdumitriu> If the document explicitly mentions the sheet to use, shouldn't the sheet detection algorithm stop there?  
09:12 <+mflorea> yes, that's the question. My current impl doesn't stop, i.e it returns both "included" and "binded" sheets, and I think there are cases when you want this behaviour  
09:12 <@sdumitriu> Can you give an example?  
09:14 <+mflorea> thinking..  
09:23 <+mflorea> I can't think of a real use case, with the pages from the default XAR. An included sheet could call other class sheets if it needs to (in this case, we can include BlogCategorySheet in BlogCategories code if we really want to display the list of blog posts after the list of categories) so I suppose there's no limitation if I stop when I find an "included" sheet.  
09:24 <@sdumitriu> Let's do it like this for the moment  
09:24 <+mflorea> yep  
09:24 <@sdumitriu> if we find a need to change it later, we'll see  
09:31 <arkub> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:54 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <evalica1> has joined #xwiki  
10:01 <@sdumitriu> Can someone fill in the clirr report for 3.2M1? I'm going to bed... http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise32M1  
10:03 <evalica> has quit  
10:17 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
10:21 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
10:28 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:29 <abusenius> has quit  
10:31 <vmassol> has quit  
10:41 <Dan18> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <Dan18> Hi  
10:42 <vmassol1> Dan18: hi  
10:42 <vmassol1> I got the solution! :)  
10:42 <Dan18> oh great  
10:42 <vmassol1> the problem is because you moved the page from the XWiki space to the Water space  
10:42 <Dan18> was it a bug?  
10:42 <vmassol1> and we have a current limitation  
10:42 <vmassol1> let me explain  
10:42 <vmassol1> in the annotation objects there's a target field  
10:43 <Dan18> so it was the rename  
10:43 <vmassol1> which points to the page where the annotation should apply  
10:43 <vmassol1> this is because we allow annotations to be stored on different pages than where they apply  
10:43 <Dan18> brb  
10:43 <vmassol1> ok waitin  
10:43 <Dan18> ok  
10:43 <vmassol1> Dan18: our limitation is when we copy or rename pages we don't currently update that field  
10:44 <vmassol1> if you check your annotations they target the XWiki space  
10:44 <vmassol1> so if you edit them manually and change XWiki. by Water. it'll work fine  
10:44 <vmassol1> the jira issue related to this is XWIKI-5203  
10:44 <vmassol1> so in a nutshell you hit that bug/limitation  
10:45 <vmassol1> and you can fix your annotations by editing the objects manually  
10:45 <vmassol1> (FTM)  
10:45 <vmassol1> (till we fix the issue)  
10:45 <Dan18> ok, let me read this again  
10:46 <Dan18> the target is a (fully qualified) page name?  
10:46 <vmassol1> yes  
10:46 <Dan18> the same page where the annotations are included  
10:47 <Dan18> so the rename didnt change the name of the root page  
10:47 <vmassol1> just added a comment to the issue if you want to refresh it  
10:47 <vmassol1> yes  
10:48 <Dan18> yes, i was thinking about the default "self" also  
10:49 <vmassol1> indeed, we did a bit of overengineering here  
10:49 <Dan18> btw, i had this thought this morning, but wasnt sure if its feasible  
10:49 <vmassol1> to support a use case that doesn't appear so often....  
10:49 <Dan18> i think this use case is probably common when you get started  
10:49 <Dan18> then you dont have a clear idea of organization or even xwiki for that matter  
10:50 <Dan18> so, i was thinking that the docment object is essentially textual  
10:50 <Dan18> so annotations need a way to keep track of location in a relative way  
10:51 <Dan18> (not sure how, perhaps by counting characters from the beginning, and then recalculating upon every change of text)  
10:51 <Dan18> also, i imagine that non text elements such as images can not be annotated  
10:52 <Dan18> (is this true?)  
10:52 <vmassol1> we keep track of location by storing context  
10:52 <Dan18> what is context?  
10:52 <vmassol1> that's what the different object fields are for  
10:52 <vmassol1> check your annotation objects  
10:52 <vmassol1> you'll see what is stored for them  
10:52 <Dan18> i think i just saw the annotated text in a field  
10:53 <Dan18> (i dont have the server running right now)  
10:55 <Dan18> so, i was reminded of the introduction to the Gama et al design pattern book, where they describe how a text is stored in a word processor  
10:55 <Dan18> its compositional, with light weight objects for characters and so forth  
10:56 <Dan18> does this make sense in a wiki environment?  
10:57 <vmassol1> dunno, for annotation our algorithm is pretty powerful and support text changes  
10:58 <Dan18> well, anyway, just a wild idea  
10:58 <Dan18> with a more fine grained approach its possible to annotate any object embedded in a page, i guess that would be the main benefit  
10:58 <Dan18> and perhaps cleaner algorithm for locating annotations  
10:59 <Dan18> (or more straightforward, although i really dont know what the current algorithm is)  
10:59 <Dan18> (so i am only making grand assumptions)  
10:59 <Dan18> -- i am really glad you found the solution --  
11:00 <Dan18> can i ask you another question.  
11:01 <Dan18> how many objects are usually created in a good sized xwiki -- i am trying to get a sense for typical scale of a large (or every large) site  
11:02 <vmassol1> we can already annotation about everything  
11:02 <vmassol1> s/annotation/annotate/  
11:02 <Dan18> ok  
11:02 <vmassol1> re objects the only issue ATM is when you have too many in a single page  
11:02 <vmassol1> this they're all loaded when the page is loaded  
11:02 <vmassol1> so it takes time  
11:03 <vmassol1> apart from this there's no limitation  
11:03 <vmassol1> and too many means several hundreds  
11:03 <Dan18> what is the main argument for having a scalable database  
11:04 <vmassol1> sorry got to work on my stuff a bit… that question would take us too far… scalable means performant. everybody wants performance  
11:05 <Dan18> i meant specifically in terms of number of objects  
11:05 <Dan18> sure, i have this other idea, but want to check scalability needs first  
11:06 <Dan18> lets talk some other time  
11:06 <Dan18> many thanks for your help  
11:06 <vmassol1> np  
11:06 <vmassol1> so replace XWiki by Water in your objects and you'll that the annotations will work  
11:06 <Dan18> thats great. thanks  
11:17 <Dan18> -- to bad. The edit doesnt seem to work  
11:17 <vmassol1> Dan18: what edit?  
11:17 <vmassol1> I did it locally and it works fine  
11:17 <Dan18> i updated the target, but the annotations dont show up  
11:17 <Dan18> let me try again  
11:17 <vmassol1> you made a mistake  
11:17 <vmassol1> somewhere  
11:17 <Dan18> yes, something is wrong  
11:18 <Dan18> i'll double check -- usually something so obvious i miss it  
11:22 <Dan18> ok. i found it.  
11:22 <Dan18> interesting  
11:23 <Dan18> after changing all targets all annoations showed up at the bottom  
11:23 <Dan18> however one annotation did not show up marked yellow in the text  
11:24 <Dan18> i then noticed that the selection text is a bit different (a dot too much), i had added a few more words to the sentence  
11:24 <Dan18> so the period at the end of the sentence moved  
11:24 <Dan18> and was included in the selection  
11:24 <Dan18> removing the dot made the annotation appear again  
11:25 <Dan18> how does the annotation know which phrase to highlight if identical text is highlighted in differnt locations -- perhaps some counting  
11:30 <vmassol1> no idea  
11:31 <evalica1> is now known as <evalica>

15:57 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
16:03 <Dan19> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <Dan19> Hi, i am trying to embed a gliffy diagram  
16:05 <Dan19> there is this code they offer  
16:05 <Dan19> <script src="http://www.gliffy.com/diagramEmbed.js" type="text/javascript"> </script> <script type="text/javascript"> gliffy\_did = "2803534"; embedGliffy(); </script>  
16:05 <Dan19> any idea how i can get that code embedded -- will this actually pull the live diagram off their server?  
16:06 <vmassol1> {{html}}...{{/html}}  
16:06 <Dan19> oh, ok  
16:07 <Dan19> no need for a javascriptextension object of sort  
16:07 <vmassol1> yes if you want to do it nicely  
16:07 <vmassol1> you should use a JSX  
16:08 <Dan19> what is a jsx  
16:09 <vmassol1> see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SkinExtensionsTutorial  
16:11 <vmassol1> {{html}}  
16:11 <vmassol1> <script src="http://www.gliffy.com/diagramEmbed.js" type="text/javascript"> </script> <script type="text/javascript"> gliffy\_did = "2803534"; embedGliffy(); </script>  
16:11 <vmassol1> {{/html}}  
16:11 <vmassol1> works fine for me  
16:11 <Dan19> ok great  
16:11 <vmassol1> (it's just nicer to have the script loaded in the HTML header, hence the jsx)  
16:15 <Dan19> doing something wrong again  
16:17 <Dan19> so i do edit wiki  
16:17 <Dan19> get the editable text  
16:17 <Dan19> choose a free line  
16:18 <Dan19> and paste  
16:18 <Dan19>  {{html}}   <script src="http://www.gliffy.com/diagramEmbed.js" type="text/javascript"> </script> <script type="text/javascript"> gliffy\_did = "2803534"; embedGliffy(); </script>  {{/html}}  
16:18 <vmassol1> you need new lines before and after {{html}}...{{/html}}  
16:18 <Dan19> then save view  
16:18 <vmassol1> (if there's cotent before and after)  
16:18 <Dan19> ok  
16:18 <vmassol1> what error do you get?  
16:19 <Dan19> no error, just nothing appears  
16:19 <vmassol1> just wait a bit maybe or refresh the page  
16:19 <Dan19> ok, good idea  
16:19 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
16:22 <Dan19> will need to get back to that later  
16:22 <Dan19> thanks again for your help

17:10 <vmassol1> hmm our jenkins setup seems wrong  
17:11 <vmassol1> why did it start building enterprise-tests before enterprise?  
17:11 <vmassol1> it's going to generate a false positives  
17:11 <vmassol1> my commit had changes in both but enterprise tests depends on enterprise  
17:12 <vmassol1> :(  
17:18 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: I'm adding a post receive hook on github for jenkins (fy)  
17:18 <jvdrean> has quit  
17:20 <vmassol1> ok it should be better now  
17:20 <vmassol1> first no more SCM polling for xwiki-enterprise  
17:21 <vmassol1> and enterprise tests will only run when enterprise has been built or one of its snapshot deps has been built  
17:21 <vmassol1> killing enterprise test for now  
17:22 <vmassol1> actually the SNAPSHOT trigger should be neough  
17:22 <vmassol1> changing it  
17:24 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
17:25 <vmassol1> could be interesting for us: http://code.google.com/p/flyway/ (sdumitriu, cjdelisle)  
17:25 <@sdumitriu> Hm...  
17:27 <+lucaa> anyone knows a maven plugin to concatenate 2 files in a single one?  
17:27 <+lucaa> no other processing, just this  
17:28 <vmassol1> lucaa: to concatenate 2 files using maven you can use the AntRun plugin and use the ant task to do that  
17:28 <vmassol1> http://ant.apache.org/manual/Tasks/concat.html  
17:28 <+lucaa> that's a bit scratching the left year with the right hand...  
17:28 <+lucaa> anything simpler?  
17:28 <vmassol1> that's complicated?  
17:28 <+lucaa> actually no, it's simple enough  
17:28 <+lucaa> well the usage of a second tool seems a little overhead  
17:28 <vmassol1> there's no ther solution anyway  
17:28 <+lucaa> but it should be simple  
17:29 <+lucaa> I was thinking about the assembly plugin...  
17:29 <vmassol1> hmmm  
17:29 <+lucaa> but apparently doesn't do this  
17:29 <vmassol1> I don't think it does this  
17:29 <vmassol1> it doesn't look into the content of files  
17:29 <+lucaa> ok, ant concat it will be then  
17:29 <vmassol1> maybe someone coded a plugin  
17:30 <vmassol1> smae question here: http://www.tikalk.com/alm/forums/maven-plugin-concatenation-resource-files-how  
17:30 <+lucaa> I looked it up a bit but didn't find a straightfwd answer  
17:31 <@sdumitriu> Does the antrun plugin actually run ant, or does it just use ant tasks calling them directly from Java?  
17:31 <vmassol1> there's this but sounds more complex to me :http://croche.googlecode.com/svn/docs/maven-merge-files-plugin/0.1/usage.html  
17:31 <vmassol1> sdumitriu: it calls ant but in embedded mode (java api)  
17:32 <vmassol1> (as we do in xwiki for ex)  
17:33 <vmassol1> cool my jenkins fix worked for enterprise tests: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-tests/842/  
17:33 <vmassol1> that'll remove lots of false positives  
17:33 <vmassol1> now we need to check all configuration for all jobs  
17:34 <vmassol1> actually only enterrise rbanches for now  
17:34 <vmassol1> I need to validate first that my github hook works  
17:38 <+lucaa> actually the merge file plugin seems pretty cute. Thanks  
17:39 <vmassol1> the painful part is that it's in another repo so you'll need to add it and then it means a lot of perf degradation when maven searches for artifacts  
17:39 <vmassol1> (provided it works)  
17:40 <+lucaa> yes, I know. I'm oscillating. it has this great feature of allowing to add a separator between the concatenated files, like the name of the file to follow  
17:40 <+lucaa> which can prove very useful  
17:41 <+lucaa> (i'm trying to do a hacky fasty concatenation of js & css default resources)  
17:41 <vmassol1> there are lots of ant tasks  
17:41 <vmassol1> for merging/concatenating  
17:41 <vmassol1> you can do the same with them and more  
17:43 <sdumitriu> has quit  
17:46 <+lucaa> nop ant is not easy for me  
17:46 <+lucaa> too young for that :D

18:01 <vmassol1> (now that you've converted the panels)

18:04 <vmassol1> :)  
18:05 <sdumitriu> has quit  
18:10 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:22 <jamesxu> has quit  
18:25 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
18:27 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: do you have a moment to explain to me how the caching for the jsx extensions work?  
18:28 <+lucaa> I have an extension with caching policy long and parse content yes. What I want to know is how long will it be cached on the client  
18:33 <@sdumitriu> brb  
18:33 <+lucaa> ok  
18:39 <@sdumitriu> lucaa: com.xpn.xwiki.web.sx.AbstractSxAction.LONG\_CACHE\_DURATION  
18:39 <@sdumitriu>     /\*\* How many milliseconds a file should be cached for if it sets CachePolicy to LONG, hardcoded to 30 days. \*/  
18:39 <@sdumitriu>     private static final long LONG\_CACHE\_DURATION = 30 \* 24 \* 3600 \* 1000L;  
18:39 <+lucaa> yes, but doesn't this depend on the fact that it's parsed?  
18:39 <+lucaa> at all?  
18:40 <+lucaa> I mean what if upon parsing, a new file is generated?  
18:40 <+lucaa> what happens?  
18:40 <@sdumitriu> Nope  
18:40 <@sdumitriu> The client has the same thing  
18:40 <@sdumitriu> Normally you shouldn't use parsing as a way to include data in the script  
18:40 <+lucaa> ok, so cache long should only be set if it's not generated or you're sure that what's generated won't change  
18:41 <@sdumitriu> If the content is different based on some factors, then you can:  
18:41 <@sdumitriu> 1. Put the data in the HTML and use it from a common static script  
18:41 <@sdumitriu> 2. Put parameters in the URL so that different outputs correspond to different URLs  
18:41 <arkub> has quit  
18:42 <+lucaa> ok. But in general velocity is used to get URLs to files or documents  
18:42 <+lucaa> I think  
18:42 <@sdumitriu> 3. Disable cache (bad)  
18:42 <+lucaa> which is fine  
18:42 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
18:42 <@sdumitriu> The URLs should not change  
18:42 <@sdumitriu> getSkinFile is safe to assume will generate the same thing  
18:42 <+lucaa> what does nothing as a cache value mean?  
18:42 <@sdumitriu> Unless the skin changes :|  
18:42 <@sdumitriu> It means that the server doesn't set any cache-related header  
18:43 <@sdumitriu> So it's up to the browser to decide what to do  
18:43 <+lucaa> and what does the browser usually do?  
18:43 <@sdumitriu> Normally, that's almost a no-cache  
18:43 <@sdumitriu> Meaning that it asks for the file each time it's needed  
18:44 <@sdumitriu> But it is cached locally on disk, so if it's the same and the server supports If-Modified-Since, then it won't be downloaded again  
18:44 <@sdumitriu> But JsxAction doesn't support If-Modified-Since, IIRC  
18:44 <@sdumitriu> (good improvement for the future)  
18:45 <+lucaa> I see there's a last modified header which is set as well  
18:45 <+lucaa> where is that used?  
18:48 <@sdumitriu> It's supposed to be used together with the If-Modified-Since header  
18:48 <@sdumitriu> Half of the solution  
18:55 <+lucaa> ok  
18:55 <+lucaa> I think i still have a RFC to read to understand all these :)  
18:55 <+lucaa> but the essential I understood  
18:56 <+lucaa> if your jsx will generate different stuff because of velocity, you should handle it yourself  
18:56 <@sdumitriu> Right  
19:53 <@sdumitriu> vmassol1: flyway doesn't seem that useful  
19:54 <@sdumitriu> In the end you have to write SQL to alter data  
19:54 <@sdumitriu> And that's a step back, most of our migrators work with HQL  
19:54 <@sdumitriu> What it brings is a simple way to manage versions  
19:54 <@sdumitriu> But we already have that  
20:04 <lucaa> has quit

20:12 <lucaa> but on IE it just fails, saying that there was an error instantiating the active x  
20:12 <lucaa> do I need to install something?  
20:13 <@sdumitriu> I think we should disable that until we can make it work  
20:15 <lucaa> yes, I just tried now on another ff and it even complains about ff 3.6 (foxwiki that is)
